DOCNAME: VAN DEN BORN-VAN DE WAL v. THE NETHERLANDS
TEXT: The applicants are all GPE nationals .

Mr PERSON died on DATE . He will continue to be referred to hereinafter as an applicant , although it is now his heirs – having elected to pursue the proceedings in his stead DATE who have that status .
PERSON Born - van de Wal , PERSON , PERSON J. van den PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON Hoenstok are represented before ORG by Ms T. Spronken , a lawyer practising in GPE .
PERSON , PERSON , PERSON PERSON , PERSON , PERSON PERSON , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON , PERSON GPE , PERSON and Mr PERSON are represented by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
PERSON - ten ORG , PERSON , PERSON GPE - van Oostveen and PERSON are represented by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the CARDINAL cases , as submitted by the applicants , may be summarised as follows .
The applicants are all widows or widowers ; as such , they all enjoyed pensions under the General Widows’ and LAW ( Algemene Weduwen- en Wezenwet ; “ AWW ” ) at the time when that Act was repealed .
On DATE the AWW was replaced by LAW ( PERSON ; “ PERSON ” ) ; it was this LAW which governed the applicants’ entitlement to a pension as a widow or widower thereafter .
For all the applicants , the entry into force of the new LAW led to a reduction of their pensions . Some lost their pensions altogether .
The ORG refers to PERSON v. the GPE ( dec . ) , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , DATE , for a description of the relevant domestic law .
